column5: Woohoooo, that is one impressive Salmon Carole, way to go  I'm expecting tonight Cliff is going to try and up the ante once again      Gotta love a give and take relationship  Just super you two.  Joey
SWEEEETTTT!!   I understand why you can't type Bly   lol   sore arms eh.  congrats.
Nice salmon !!!!!!.  ...great catch carol,congrats on your PB.....cheers
Wow...Nice fish Bly...  I knew you would do it... WTG
Nice salmon! Thats one big chinook! Congrats on the PB
wtg on your pb salmon Bly and keep up the great fishing. You too Cliff.

Great going guys, that's an awesome Salmon. As for the weight, I know when the Salmon start having that jaw they are not eating as much and losing weight, that may explain the lower weight. When I caught my 24lber downrigging, he was only 36" long.

Well, with some people joking about why it's me that catches all the Salmon and Bly cant seem to hook into them, the tables were turned tonight....big time!  Greencoachdog called it a few days ago by saying "I've got a feeling she's gonna play catch up one of these days soon and it aint gonna be pretty for ya!".  I replied to that saying I have done no gloating and that I fully expect her to kick my butt...and soon!  Anyhow, onto tonight.  We headed off to chuck some spoons at the mouth of a local creek.  There were lots of other anglers around and our favourite spots were taken.  Oh well...shore fishing means LOTS of improvising!!  We could see lots of lightning in the distance, so we knew our outing may be cut short if it got too close.  Bly starts casting her glow in the dark cleo, and about 20 minutes into it....when it was only about 2 feet in front of her, this monster attacks the spoon!! It must have followed it in and decided it was now or never.  This thing cleared the water by a few feet on a few occasions, but she expertly kept tension on the rod to make sure this one couldn't spit the hook.  It tried to run, but it couldn't find the deeper water, so she kept gaining ground on it.  Finally...after about 15 minutes, I'm able to net this fish.  As soon as I saw it, I knew she crushed my PB (38" and 19.5 pounds).  This one measured in at a whopping 40" and 22 pounds 11 ounces!!!  She attained her goal of getting at least one Salmon this year, but this one qualifies for an OFAH award...makes it that much sweeter.  She needed 5 species to get her avid angler award for the year and this one makes it 6!! (I always said I didn't want my 5th species to be panfish....LOL)  Here's the pic....   Oh yeah....this is another entry for Team 9 in the OFC tourney!!!! (we have a pic with the sign)
Wooohooooooo!!  Nice fish Bly!!   WTG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   Bill
WTG Bly and that is one fat fish Carole.My jaw just dropped and good job with the net Cliff  .   What a groovy night out .I had a feeling you guys were out.  MTP
crazy!
Oh wow... that thing really is a huge! Conratulations!
HA!!! I knew it!!! That's an Excellent Salmonoid Carloe, Congratulations!!!... and good on you for the moral support and netmanship Cliff!
Wow way to go SIS. That is one impressive fish . Great job  all the way around.
WOW Whata fish Bly way to go...
Awesome fish Bly.  Congrats.  007
Nice fish. The picture of the fish makes bly look small.  Congrats.
Thats a HOG.  I would have thought it weighed more though, Ive only ever caught two salmon at 40 inches, one was 40 inches and 26 pounds and one was 44 inches and a touch under 30 pounds.  NICE fish
Great googley moogely Carole thats one big fish.  Congratulations!

Holy!  That's amazing!  Congrats on the new PB Bly!  It sure does look to be heavier than 22 pounds.  Are you sure Cliff isn't trying to take advantage of this opportunity by weighing your fish in at 5 pounds lighter so that it would be more attainable to beat?  Cliff, you should watch her, check her pockets.  There may be a tube of something that she may rub on your lures from here on in.  I think my girlfriend has rubbed A535 and Anusol all over mine so that I can't challenge her 2 big Musky.  Great job again!
Well you know they say the camera adds 5 lbs. lol
DAng Carole, that's one sweet fish!!    Congrats on the new PB  Maureen
that is one nice fish,wtg Bly
WTG. but is that not a carp pic lol once again congrats. Peace Ken
SHHHHHHHHHHHHHH......well........she files all my hook points so that they are not sharp.....
Hey Cliff, good net job.  WTG Carole on your PB salmon!
Dang!
Nice fish way to go Bly! Can't believe how quickly they're turning colour.....
Well the fish may not have cooperated too well on Saturday for ya but you're certainly making up for it now!!  CONGRATS!!!!!
Congrats Bly, I knew it was just a matter of time when this happens.   That's a nice fish in any standard.
Very nice fish
Beast!!! Congrats on your new PB bly
